answer:
All Aircraft must have an annual inspection, defined by 14 CFR part 43, appendix D. Additionally, Aircraft which are available for rent or held out to the public for other commercial operations must have a 100 hour inspection, in addition to an annual inspection.

Club planes do not have to have 100 hour inspections because WCFC aircraft are not rented to the general public. This is a private club with the aircraft only available to club membership. Commercial operations in club aircraft are not permitted.
question: What is the difference in 100hr vs annual, do club planes have to have both? Why not?
